Message.Issue: 'App.OnStartup(StartupEventArgs)' locks on a reference of type 'string'. Replace this with a lock against an object with strong-identity.

Message.TypeName: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Message.Issue: Object 'searcher' can be disposed more than once in method 'CLAppDelegate.GetProcessOwner(int)'. To avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.: Lines: 278

Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'OleDbCommand.OleDbCommand(string, OleDbConnection)' in 'CLAppDelegate.LocateMovedCloudFolder()' could contain the following variables 'sCloudFolderCreationTimeUtc', 'sCloudFolderCreationTimeUtcPlusOneSecond'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Message.TypeName: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Message.Issue: Object 'memoryStream' can be disposed more than once in method 'WindowPlacement.GetPlacement(IntPtr)'. To avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.: Lines: 116

Field 'WINDOWPLACEMENT.normalPosition' is a member of type 'WINDOWPLACEMENT', which is serializable, but is of type 'RECT', which is not serializable. Add the NonSerializedAttribute to 'WINDOWPLACEMENT.normalPosition'.

Implement IDisposable on 'CLUIActivityService' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'Timer'. If 'CLUIActivityService' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.

As it is declared in your code, the return type of P/Invoke 'NativeMethods.SHAppBarMessage(int, ref NativeMethods.APPBARDATA)' will be 4 bytes wide on 64-bit platforms. This is not correct, as the actual native declaration of this API indicates it should be 8 bytes wide on 64-bit platforms. Consult the MSDN Platform SDK documentation for help determining what data type should be used instead of 'int'.

Message.TypeName: Provide correct arguments to formatting methods
Message.Issue: Method 'FramePreferencesAdvancedViewModel.MoveCloudFolderWithUserInteraction(string, string)' calls 'string.Format(string, object, object)' with a format string that contains an unexpected character '"}"' at index '121'. The provided format string is: '"The new location must be at or in your home directory ({0}, and it can\'t be ins..."'
'FramePreferencesAdvancedViewModel.ScheduleCloudFolderMove(string, string)' locks on a reference of type 'string'. Replace this with a lock against an object with strong-identity.

Rule.TypeName: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Rule.Name: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Rule.Description: A correctly implemented Dispose method can be called multiple times without throwing an exception. However, this is not guaranteed and to avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.
Rule.Resolution: Object {0} can be disposed more than once in method {1}. To avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.: Lines: 116

Rule.Name: Do not call overridable methods in constructors
Rule.Description: Virtual methods defined on the class should not be called from constructors. If a derived class has overridden the method, the derived class version will be called (before the derived class constructor is called).
Rule.Resolution: {0} contains a call chain that results in a call to a virtual method defined by the class. Review the following call stack for unintended consequences: {1}

Rule.Name: Do not lock on objects with weak identity
Rule.Description: Don't take locks on objects that may bleed across AppDomains or that don't have a strong identity.
Rule.Resolution: {0} locks on a reference of type {1}. Replace this with a lock against an object with strong-identity.

Rule.Name: Interface methods should be callable by child types
Rule.Description: Explicit method implementations are defined with private accessibility. Classes that derive from classes with explicit method implementations and choose to re-declare them on the class will not be able to call into the base class implementation unless the base class has provided an alternate method with appropriate accessibility. When overriding a base class method that has been hidden by explicit interface implementation, in order to call into the base class implementation, a derived class must cast the base pointer to the relevant interface. When calling through this reference, however, the derived class implementation will actually be invoked, resulting in recursion and an eventual stack overflow.
Rule.Resolution: Make {0} sealed (a breaking change if this class has previously shipped), implement the method non-explicitly, or implement a new method that exposes the functionality of {1} and is visible to derived classes.

Rule.Name: Mark all non-serializable fields
Rule.Description: All fields that cannot be serialized directly should have the NonSerializedAttribute. Types that have the SerializableAttribute should not have fields of types that do not have the SerializableAttribute unless the fields are marked with the NonSerializedAttribute.
Rule.Resolution: Field {0} is a member of type {1}, which is serializable, but is of type {2}, which is not serializable. Add the NonSerializedAttribute to {0}.

Rule.Name: P/Invoke declarations should be portable
Rule.Resolution: As it is declared in your code, the return type of P/Invoke {0} will be {1} bytes wide on {2} platforms. This is not correct, as the actual native declaration of this API indicates it should be {3} bytes wide on {2} platforms. Consult the MSDN Platform SDK documentation for help determining what data type should be used instead of {4}.

Rule.TypeName: Provide correct arguments to formatting methods
Rule.Name: Provide correct arguments to formatting methods
Rule.Description: Provide the correct number of arguments to String.Format calls.
Rule.Resolution: Method {0} calls {1} with a format string that contains an unexpected character '{2}' at index '{3}'. The provided format string is: '{4}'

Rule.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Name: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Description: A SQL command string built from user input is vulnerable to SQL injection attacks. Microsoft SQL Server and other database servers support stored procedures and parameterized SQL queries, which reduce the risk of injection attacks.
Rule.Resolution: The query string passed to {0} in {1} could contain the following variables {2}. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Rule.Name: Types that own disposable fields should be disposable
Rule.Description: Types that declare disposable members should also implement IDisposable. If the type does not own any unmanaged resources, do not implement a finalizer on it.
Rule.Resolution: Implement IDisposable on {0} because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: {1}. If {0} has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
